definitions: To escort or lead someone to a particular place or in a particular direction.
To accept someone as a partner, spouse, or associate.
To transport someone from one place to another.
To assume responsibility for someone's care or well-being.
examples: He will take s.o. to the dance.
She decided to take s.o. as her husband.
The music can take s.o. to another world.
The bus will take s.o. downtown.
They will take s.o. under their wing.
